title: I love you league but every single patch day you fucking drop the ball.
body:
Holy Fuck. I've literally just used up my whole months internet today on this stupid fucking patch and it's most likely something thats not even your fault but your the easy blame so fuck you. 

Back story time. I'm a student so unfortunately living is like a major cost in my expenses and internet is a semi needed thing. I have a little modemy thing that gives me 7 gigs a "month" and I literally reset it yesterday. 

Every time I try to patch this fucking happens and after going through every quick fixe again and doing the 'bull shit repairing' and then deleting this exact file in the folder in the yada. I'm usually left with just reinstalling the whole game.

So once again I've done that and left it, walked away cooled of a bit pretended to do an assignment, you know uni stuff. I come back and what do I fucking see. Fucking 23 percent done 'unexpected error go Fuck yourself' it didn't even have the decency to pretend to get to 33 or 99 percent. 

League cost me $59 today for nothing. Absolutely fucking nothing. And unfortunately I'm stupid enough to try again in a weeks time when I get paid and it'll be the same fucking thing. 

I honestly hate complaining but this literallry happens every time but now I have to pay for my internet and that shit adds up.

TLDR
I love you lol. I'm going to continue to play you. But I honestly fucking hate you.

replies.body:
It's the new patcher. Ever since they changed it, people have been getting problems. Maybe they didn't let it gracefully decompose?

Have you tried running it in admin mode instead of just normal mode?

Yeah iv'e done ok last couple of patches but previously it was always a shitstorm and i'm sure it will happen again in the future.

It's funny how some of their updates basically say they changed nothing but simple champion stats (which in no way affects clients ability to perform otherwise), which tells me they either aren't really upfront about what they changed (I do some hobbiest programming so honestly I expect more detail), or the patching process has some issues.

And what's with the random updates (usually quite small) with 0 information what so ever, but still ask you to re-agree to their terms and conditions without telling you what they did, dodgy as fuck.
